title: Supervisory Analyst - Exiger Government Solutions
content:
Supervisory Analyst - Exiger Government Solutions (EGS) 
The Supervisory Analyst role within Exiger Government Solutions (EGS) is a key leadership position responsible for guiding and overseeing the analytical efforts of a team of dedicated analysts. The role is based in the United States and requires a strong technical background, exceptional communication skills, and a proven track record in delivering high-quality analysis and intelligence assessments.
Key Responsibilities:

Lead and mentor a team of analysts in researching, analyzing, and producing intelligence assessments related to force protection, counterterrorism, counterintelligence, supply chain security, CFIUS (Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States), personnel vetting, and other relevant areas to support client accounts.
Collaborate with analysts to explore and leverage new data sources, develop effective queries, and integrate information from diverse sources to provide clients with a comprehensive understanding of their mission environment.
Oversee the use of Exiger’s artificial intelligence document review platform for information searches and the identification of potential adverse information.
Develop and maintain expert knowledge of the client’s priorities, advocate for the company, and foster strong client and internal relationships.
Lead by example, maintain a positive and professional attitude with clients, and establish a culture of excellence within the team.
Perform quality control on analysis, ensuring the accuracy and completeness of intelligence assessments.
Prepare presentations and quantitative exhibits to communicate project scope, findings, and recommendations.
Work independently to meet mission requirements and provide guidance to team members as needed.
Multitask effectively and collaborate within diverse teams.

Professional Experience Required:

U.S. citizenship is mandatory.
Substantial analytical experience, including a minimum of 3-5 years managing risk for U.S. government spending programs focused on advanced technology.
Proficiency in analytical research and industry tools for data management and analysis.
Advanced skills in data tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, etc., as well as expertise in data visualization tools and techniques.
Exceptional ability to draw high-level assessments from research and data.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills for briefing complex analytical matters to diverse audiences.
Strong organizational skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks and work under pressure.
Proven leadership skills with a track record of effective team management and mentorship.

Knowledge and Skills:

Demonstrable interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate analytical findings clearly and accurately.
Capacity to evaluate the relevance and importance of material, extract data pertaining to the assigned subject matter, and draw well-founded conclusions from the analysis.
Proficiency in conducting open-source research and extracting information from extensive datasets.
Strong understanding of clients' missions and priorities.
In-depth knowledge of domains relevant to Exiger’s capabilities.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including formula expertise (e.g., vlookups, if statements) and the ability to use pivot tables.

 
We’re an amazing place to work. Why?

Discretionary Time Off for all employees, with no maximum limits on time off
Industry leading health, vision, and dental benefits
Competitive compensation package
16 weeks of fully paid parental leave
Flexible, hybrid approach to working from home and in the office where applicable
Focus on wellness and employee health through stipends and dedicated wellness programming
Purposeful career development programs with reimbursement provided for educational certifications

#LI-Remote
 
This position is remote eligible within the United States, excluding residents of California, Colorado, and New York.
 Exiger is revolutionizing the way corporations, government agencies and banks manage risk and compliance with a combination of technology-enabled and SaaS solutions. In recognition of the growing volume and complexity of data and regulation, Exiger is committed to creating a more sustainable risk and compliance environment through its holistic and innovative approach to problem solving. Exiger's mission to make the world a safer place to do business drives its award-winning AI technology platform, DDIQ, built to anticipate the market's most pressing needs related to evolving ESG, cyber, financial crime, third-party and supply chain risk. Exiger has won 30+ AI, RegTech and Supply Chain partner awards.
Exiger’s core values are courage, excellence, expertise, innovation, integrity, teamwork and trust.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.
